title: Private program policy page still accessible after user left the program

profile.name: HackerOne
profile.about: Vulnerability disclosure should be safe, transparent, and rewarding.

vulnerability_information:
Hi Team,

**Summary:**

I have found a critical sensitive information disclosure, I'm not sure if this is a result of a new hackerone UI update, I observed that some of the UI has been change such as `Hacktivity` etc.

__BUG:__ Now all private program policy page together with the updates is visible to me despite i already leave to those private program!

__WHOLE POLICY PAGE WAS DISCLOSED:__

Below screenshot is the sample, the private program name is ██████ which i already __LEAVE__ long time ago, but now i can see their policy page!

██████

## Impact

Private program disclcosure.
vulnerability_information_html:
Hi Team,

Summary:

I have found a critical sensitive information disclosure, I'm not sure if this is a result of a new hackerone UI update, I observed that some of the UI has been change such as Hacktivity etc.

BUG: Now all private program policy page together with the updates is visible to me despite i already leave to those private program!

WHOLE POLICY PAGE WAS DISCLOSED:

Below screenshot is the sample, the private program name is ██████ which i already LEAVE long time ago, but now i can see their policy page!

██████

Impact

Private program disclcosure.

activities.message:
Hi Team,

It seems this is happening when you are invited  to the program, submit a report, __then decided to leave__ the program, the behavior before is when you leave the private program, you will not be able to access their policy page and updates because it contains all sensitive information regarding the program such as `bounty` (bounty statistics), `resolved reports`, `# hackers thanks`, `minimum bounty` and `response efficiency`.  

Below is the steps to reproduce:

### Steps to reproduce:

  1. Assume that you are invited to ███ private program
  2. Submit a report to them.
  3. Now leave their private program.
  4. After leaving their program, try to access ████████, you will observed that you can still access the policy page and updates

Before it returns 404 when you already leave, __but__ now you can view the policy page and you can see their updated information such as bounty statistics and response efficiency, as well as whole policy including scope, bounty table etc.

Let me know if anything else is needed.

Regards
Japz

Steps to reproduce:

activities.message: Hi @japz - nice find, we'll get this fixed! We'll get back to you early next week with an update early next week. Happy hacking!
activities.markdown_message: Hi @japz - nice find, we'll get this fixed! We'll get back to you early next week with an update early next week. Happy hacking!

activities.message:
Hi @jobert 

Thanks for triaging and bounty, btw i would like to ask why the severity becomes `Medium` , i believed it is `High` or `Critical` due to the amount of sensitive data that is expose here and it didn't even require any user interaction, those sensitive data includes the below list:

- Whole Program Policy (this will show all new policy updates after the hacker left the program)
- Minimum bounty
- Reports resolved (No. of resolve reports)
- Response efficiency
- Average time to first response
- Average time to triage
- Average time to resolution
- Average time to bounty
- Total bounties paid
- Average bounty (Displayed as a range from the 45th to 55th percentile)
- Top bounty (Displayed as a range from the 90th to 100th percentile)
- Response efficiency percentage

__I think the amount of sensitive data can have an effect on the severity rating here, I'll appreciate if you can recheck the severity of this submission.__

>nice find, we'll get this fixed! We'll get back to you early next week with an update early next week. Happy hacking!

Sounds good, I'm glad i could help.

>Have a good weekend!

Have a good and nice weekend too :)

Cheers
Japz

nice find, we'll get this fixed! We'll get back to you early next week with an update early next week. Happy hacking!

Japz

activities.message: Hi @japz - this doesn't have a high or critical impact. For you to actually abuse this, you needed to have access to the program at some point and actually submitted a report to it. We'd consider it to be a higher risk in case you were able to enumerate profiles of programs that you've had never access to.
activities.markdown_message: Hi @japz - this doesn't have a high or critical impact. >this doesn't have a high or critical impact. For you to actually abuse this, you needed to have access to the program at some point and actually submitted a report to it.

I see, you have a good point.. i just thought the amount of data that is expose here can have an impact to the severity of this submission.

btw, my collab brother @reymark_divino submitted a couple of bugs on HackerOne own bbp, but his `Medium` submission was dups.. is this submission of mine somehow eligible for a hoodie ? , I'd like to give a gift for my little bro if possible.

Kind Regards
Japz

activities.message: Thanks again for bringing this to our attention, @japz! Also a high five to  @flashdisk, @haxta4ok00, @pappan,  @johnny, @spectator, @z3t, @kunal94, and @death_star for reporting this to us after we were made aware of this. All the sensitive has been redacted from the report, so this is ready to be disclosed. Happy hacking!
